t: Psalm 116
I*pn love the Lord,*s for he heard my voice; he*ld heard my cry for mercy.
Because*ln he turned his ear to me, I*ld will call on him as long as I live.
The*pn cords of death entangled me, the*ld anguish of the grave came over me; I*ld was overcome by distress and sorrow.
Then*ln I called on the name of the Lord:*s “Lord,*sld save me!”
The*pn Lord*s is gracious and righteous; our*ld God is full of compassion.
The*ln Lord*s protects the unwary; when*ld I was brought low, he saved me.
Return*pn to your rest, my soul, for*ld the Lord*s has been good to you.
For*pn you, Lord,*s have delivered me from death, my*ld eyes from tears, my*ld feet from stumbling,
that*ln I may walk before the Lord*s in*ld the land of the living.
I*pn trusted in the Lord*s when I said, “I*ld am greatly afflicted”;
in*ln my alarm I said, “Everyone*ld is a liar.”
What*pn shall I return to the Lord*s for*ld all his goodness to me?
I*pn will lift up the cup of salvation and*ld call on the name of the Lord.*s
I*ln will fulfill my vows to the Lord*s in*ld the presence of all his people.
Precious*pn in the sight of the Lord*s is*ld the death of his faithful servants.
Truly*ln I am your servant, Lord;*s I*ld serve you just as my mother did; you*ld have freed me from my chains.
I*pn will sacrifice a thank offering to you and*ld call on the name of the Lord.*s
I*ln will fulfill my vows to the Lord*s in*ld the presence of all his people,
in*ln the courts of the house of the Lord—*s in*ld your midst, Jerusalem. Praise*pn the Lord.*s
